title: Jhin is immune to attack speed slows
body: It will only go downhill from there . . .

See the thing is, he still gains attack speed. He builds it to gain AD. Yes, his attack speed is fixed, but when he builds the stat he still gains it.

His passive scales his AD with bonus attack speed. So, in essence, he is still gaining attack speed, but into his AD rather than every other champion in the game. That means that modifiers _technically_ still work for him. So if he loses attack speed due to a negative modifier, regardless of the fixed attack speed, he should be losing AD, because he is still, in essence, losing the attack speed.

"Lost" would be implying that Jhin builds 50% AS but only benefits from 12.5% AS AND building 12.5% AS would give him 12.5% AS normally. That's not how the process of conversion works. He builds 50% AS and benefits from 50% AS because 50% AS gives him +12.5% AD.

But the funny bit is how you assume that high AS inherently means higher dps. That is not the case. Anyone who has raided as a hunter in WoW for progression can tell you about clipping auto-shots. Why isn't haste amazing on Hunters? Because haste doesn't make your spells faster and most of your damage is white damage but yellow damage. You couldn't auto-shot while moving or casting steady shot in Wrath.

This is extremely similar to ADC behavior; you can't attack while moving or casting spells. The conclusion is the same: moving lowers white dps. Jhin's advantage is that he has a much larger window to move without clipping autos. This is in fact the reason why Kog is hard to play; the tinniest amount of movement significantly lowers his dps whereas maximizing dps makes you stand still and opens you up for retaliation.

But finally, *Attack Speed on Jhin makes all of his abilities hit harder*. Ignoring abilities that have INSANE AD ratios is ridiculous. Of course the conversion ratio isn't going to be 1:1. Why the hell would it be when Jhin can get 1k AD as is?

He can deal over 1500 raw damage. With a basic ability.

If Vlad has x AP, he gains Y HP. That's his passive. If there was an ability or item that lowered an enemy's AP, it would lower Vlad's HP. 

If Jhin has x AS, he gains Y AD. That's his passive. If Frozen Heart reduces his AS, it would lower his AD. 

Make sense?
